avalancheActivity.comment: Human triggered slab avalanche in Hrafnbjörg by Skriða, 10-12/4. Natural avalanches in SW aspects around Skjaldbreiður that have released in the last weeks.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow is considered rather stable. Cornice collapse could happen causing small slab avalanches where slabs persist. Thin snow cover and risk of slip and slide falls. Chances of wet avalanche activity during rain event this weekend.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Old windslabs are possible on firn high in mountains, especially inland, but the snow cover is mostly considered stable. A snowprofile under a cornice in Bláfjöll (17th April) gave CTM#15 at 112 cm and ECTX. Cornice collapse is possible and potentially could initiate small slab avalanches where wind slabs persist. Thin snow cover and risk of slip and slide falls. Chances of wet avalanche activity on Friday/Saturday.

travelAdvisory.comment: Layered windslab in N part of Iceland and widely weak layer by firn. Intense thaw this weekend and chances if wet avalanche activity widely, with potentially larege avalaenches where thick windslabs persist. Even sluss floods could be expected where most rain falls.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Layered windslab in N part of Iceland and widely a weak layer by firn. Thaw this weekend and chances of wet avalanche activity widely, even sluss floods where rain is heaviest.

weatherForecast.highlights: SA-átt, rigning eða slydda/snjókoma til fjalla á föstudag en snýr svo í SV-átt á um kvöldið og rignir í fjallahæð, rignir fram á sunnudagsmorgun og hlýtt í veðri.

avalancheActivity.comment: Couple of small avalanches in Kirkjubólshlíð, NW-aspect, fell early last week.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Thick windslabs on firn with a weak boundary. Heavy thaw this weekend and large wet avalanches expected.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Thick layered windslab above firn, with a weak boundary between layers. Snow is considered rather stable but people travelling in steep slopes and gullies might trigger avalanches, especially where the weaknesses are shallow, i.e. in convex landscape features and around cliffs or rocks. Snowfall on Friday afternoon with followed by rain until Sunday and heavy thaw. Highly likely that wet avalanches will release, and they could be large.

travelAdvisory.comment: Layered windslab in N part of Iceland and widely weak layer by firn. Intense thaw this weekend and chances if wet avalanche activity widely, with potentially larege avalaenches where thick windslabs persist. Even sluss floods could be expected where most rain falls.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Layered windslab in N part of Iceland and widely a weak layer by firn. Thaw this weekend and chances of wet avalanche activity widely, even sluss floods where rain is heaviest.

weatherForecast.highlights: SA-átt og snjókoma um tíma seinnipartinn á föstudag en hlýnar þegar líður á kvöldið, snýr í fremur stífa S/SV átt og fer að rigna í öllum hæðum. Rigning getur verið talsverð um tíma á laugardag og fram á sunnudagsmorgun og hlýtt í veðri.

avalancheActivity.comment: Several slabs in E-NE winds a week ago and a big slab avalanche in the NW-winds on Monday in Fljót. Many slab avalanches in repeated northerly snowstorms since the weekend before Easter. Several human triggered slabs were released and many big natural occured during the snowstorms
avalancheActivity.highlights: Layered windslabs in most aspects but mainly after prevailing NE winds. Persistent weak layer still present and risk for big avalanches due to warming on Saturday

snowpackStructure.highlights: Prevailing NE winds and heavy snow accumulation have built up layered windslabs. Snowprofiles still shows PWL at the  interfaces between windslab and firn and inbetween windslabs as well. A snowpit from Ólafsfjörður 16th of april showed a pwl below a mf crust at the surface of the old firn which failed with medium load and gave sudden planar fracture. This weakness may be at significant depths due to heavy snow accumulation lately so avalanches released down on the firn could be large. New windslab formation a week ago in E-NE winds and NW-winds on Monday.

travelAdvisory.comment: Layered windslab in N part of Iceland and widely weak layer by firn. Intense thaw this weekend and chances if wet avalanche activity widely, with potentially larege avalaenches where thick windslabs persist. Even sluss floods could be expected where most rain falls.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Layered windslab in N part of Iceland and widely a weak layer by firn. Thaw this weekend and chances of wet avalanche activity widely, even sluss floods where rain is heaviest.

weatherForecast.highlights: Gengur í SV-átt með rigningu uppá fjallstinda á föstudagskvöld, hvessir á laugardagskvöld og kólnar og styttir upp

avalancheActivity.comment: Several loose avalanches seen by Neskaupstaður on Tuesday and Wednesday. Few small avalanches have been seen around the area after last weeks snowfall and warming.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Considerable amount of snow remains high in the mountains and inland after a NE snowstorm from the last weeks. Weaknesses can be expected between wind slabs of different hardness. New snow in places in the forecasting area and loose avalanches released on Tuesday and Wednesday. Thaw is forecasted this weekend with chance of wet avalanche activity.

snowpackStructure.highlights: A lot of snow has accumulated in high elevations, NE snowstorm from the last weeks. The snow is layered, with windslabs of different hardness where a weakness could persist. A weakness deep in the snowpack could still be found in high elevations. In lower elevations the snow is mostly accumulated in gullies but firn in places. In places a rather thin layer of new snow accumulated early this week and thaw is expected during the weekend with chance of wet avalanche activity.

travelAdvisory.comment: Layered windslab in N part of Iceland and widely weak layer by firn. Intense thaw this weekend and chances if wet avalanche activity widely, with potentially larege avalaenches where thick windslabs persist. Even sluss floods could be expected where most rain falls.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Layered windslab in N part of Iceland and widely a weak layer by firn. Thaw this weekend and chances of wet avalanche activity widely, even sluss floods where rain is heaviest.

weatherForecast.highlights: Suðlæg átt næstu daga með lítilsháttar úrkomu næstu daga og hlýnandi veðri, hiti allt að 10 stigum á láglendi á laugardag.
